Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.index

Interface IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    EntityIndexSeekClient
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BridgingIndexProgressor, DefaultNodeValueIndexCursor, DefaultRelationshipIndexCursor, FullAccessNodeValueIndexCursor, NodeLabelSecurityFilter, NodeValueClientFilter, NodeValueIterator
    Enclosing interface:
    IndexProgressor
    public static interface IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient
    Client which accepts nodes and some of their property values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize​(IndexDescriptor descriptor,
                IndexProgressor progressor,
                IndexQuery[] query,
                IndexQueryConstraints constraints,
                boolean indexIncludesTransactionState)
        Setup the client for progressing using the supplied progressor. The values feed in accept map to the propertyIds provided here. Called by index implementation.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - The descriptor
        progressor - The progressor
        query - The query of this progression
        constraints - Constraints on the produced results, like the required order the index should return entity ids in, or if the index should fetch property values together with entity ids.
        indexIncludesTransactionState - true if the index takes transaction state into account such that the entities delivered through acceptEntity(long, float, Value...) have already been filtered through, and merged with, the transaction state. If this is true, then the client does not need to do its own transaction state filtering. This is the case for the fulltext schema indexes, for instance. Otherwise, if this parameter is false, then the client needs to filter and merge the transaction state in on their own.

      • acceptEntity

        boolean acceptEntity​(long reference,
                     float score,
                     Value... values)
        Accept the node id and values of a candidate index entry. Return true if the entry is accepted, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        reference - the node id of the candidate index entry
        score - a score figure for the quality of the match, for indexes where this makes sense, otherwise Float.NaN.
        values - the values of the candidate index entry
        Returns:
        true if the entry is accepted, false otherwise

      • needsValues

        boolean needsValues()
